item.title: ‘Cavalier’ approach to Child Benefit checks criticised by Treasury Committee Chair
item.description: A new letter published by the Treasury Committee confirms HMRC removed employment checks when expanding the use of flight data to detect Child Benefit fraud, after which 23,794 claimants had their payments suspended.

item.title: Do not cave in to industry scaremongering – taxes on online betting games must reflect the harms they cause say MPs
item.description: The Government must be bold in the face of industry scaremongering and tax online betting games at a rate which reflects the growth of harmful and addictive betting practices, says a report published today by the Treasury Committee.

item.title: In embracing risk to stimulate new markets, be prepared for some National Wealth Fund investments to fail, say MPs
item.description: The National Wealth Fund (NWF) must have the appetite to take risks or it is unlikely to fulfil its purpose of crowding investment into sectors which would not easily attract private funding, according to a report published by the Treasury Committee today (Tuesday 28 October).

item.title: Government should not cut the Cash ISA allowance
item.description: Cutting the Cash ISA allowance is unlikely to incentivise people to invest their cash in stocks and shares, a new report by the Treasury Select Committee warns.

item.title: Amazon outage prompts letter to Economic Secretary
item.description: Following the outage affecting Amazon Web Services, the Treasury Committee has sent a letter to the Economic Secretary to the Treasury.

item.title: Government fails to action Committee’s recommendations on reform of Lifetime ISA
item.description: The Government has not heeded warnings from the Treasury Committee that the Lifetime ISA (LISA) requires reform

item.title: Financial Ombudsman Service: departure of CEO and ‘disrespectful’ actions of Chair
item.description: A new report sets out the Treasury Select Committee’s assessment of the handling of the departure of previous Chief Executive Officer, Abby Thomas, from the Financial Ombudsman Service

item.title: Bank of England commits to monitoring cash acceptance on ongoing basis
item.description: The Government has confirmed that the Bank of England will monitor cash acceptance on an ongoing basis following a Treasury Select Committee report published earlier this year

item.title: ‘Complex’ Lifetime ISA increases risk of poor financial decisions
item.description: The Lifetime ISA’s (LISA) dual-purpose design may be diverting people away from more suitable products and putting part of their savings at risk, according to a new report

item.title: HMRC warned by Committee for handling of phishing attack
item.description: The Treasury Committee has warned HMRC that its failure to report details of a breach affecting around 100,000 taxpayers is ‘unacceptable’ in a letter published today

item.title: Risk of ‘two-tier society’ if Government does not act on cash acceptance
item.description: A lack of action from the Government to tackle declining cash acceptance could lead to a two-tier society with the most vulnerable bearing the cost, the Treasury Committee finds

item.title: MPs approve preferred candidate for Crown Estate Chair
item.description: The Government’s preferred candidate for the role of Chair of the Crown Estate, Ric Lewis, has been approved by the Treasury Committee

item.title: Can the National Wealth Fund move the dial on growth? New inquiry launched
item.description: The Treasury Committee is launching an inquiry into the NWF, aiming to understand if it has the tools and backing to drive meaningful growth in the UK economy

item.title: New Prudential Regulation Committee members approved by MPs
item.description: The Treasury Committee has published its reports on the appointments of Andrea Enria and David Soanes to the Bank of England’s Prudential Regulation Committee (PRC)

item.title: Government shares further detail on Office for Value for Money following Committee report
item.description: The Government has published a series of new documents on the Office for Value for Money (OVfM) which address issues raised by the Committee in its report earlier this year

item.title: More than one month’s worth of IT failures at major banks and building societies in the last two years
item.description: At least 158 banking IT failure incidents affected millions of customers’ ability to access and use services between January 2023 and February 2025

item.title: FCA and FOS sent letters by MPs on departure of Chief Ombudsman
item.description: The Treasury Committee has written to the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS) about the circumstances which surrounded the departure of the Chief Ombudsman, Abby Thomas, last week.

item.title: Bank outages: Committee demands answers from banks and building societies following Barclays IT failure
item.description: The Treasury Committee has written to CEOs at nine banks and building societies to request information on the scale and impact of IT failures over the last two years

item.title: Use of AI in banking, pensions and other financial services to be subject of new inquiry by MPs
item.description: A new inquiry by the Treasury Committee will consider the potential impacts of the increased use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in banking, pensions and other financial services

item.title: New Treasury cost-saving unit sparks concerns of duplication and unclear benefits for taxpayer
item.description: A lack of resources, a very short lifespan and high risk of duplication has left MPs on the Treasury Committee sceptical about the newly established Office for Value for Money
